properties.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 3 at 3:21PM MST until February 4 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
...SNOW EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH TONIGHT...

.The latest winter storm to move over Colorado will produce light
to moderate snowfall over much of the state through tonight and
into Tuesday morning. As the snow continues this evening, road
conditions across the state are expected to worsen. The storm will
be moving out of the state through the day Tuesday. Lingering
showers may produce light accumulations. As the storm moves out,
the coldest temperatures of the week are expected Wednesday
morning. Residents should remain aware of rapidly changing road
conditions this evening and be prepared for wintery travel
overnight.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 8
inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass.

* WHEN...Through 6 AM MST Tuesday. The heaviest snow will be this
evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind
chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on
exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or
visiting www.cotrip.org.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST TUESDAY
